intro: Uralepis pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful uralepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, elongated achenes as fruits. Uralepis pulchella is often found in open habitats and is adapted to semi-arid conditions.
